result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David J. Pray

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David J. Pray in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CF128 & 15CM140 @ 4:16 pm.  State gives plea agreement, 15CF128 ct 2 plea, Ct's 1, 3, 4 & 5 DRI, 15CM140 DRI. 15CF128 ct 2 imposed and stay 4 1/2 years 2 1/2 initial confinement 2 year extended supervision  stayed 3 year probation, AODA and follow through, costs, no conditional jail requested already served 6 months jail, DNA Sample and surcharge, Def. is eligible for programs.  State heard on additional charge referral on other charges will not be charged.  Atty Morgan and def. agree with plea agreement.  Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed. Def. understand charge and penalties. Agreement is Methamphetamine but statute is correct. Ct 2 No contest plea, Mnf/Dlvr Meth. repeater.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Def. understands elements.  Def. admits 3 prior convictions. State heard on priors. DRI ct's 1 3 4 & 5 and 15CM140.  Atty Morgan replys to repeater allegations.  Atty Morgan is satisfied.  Court finds plea is freely & voluntarily given.  No victims  State gives factual basis.  Atty Morgan is satisfied.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds def. Guilty to ct 2 Mnf/Dlvr Meth, repeater.  State gives sentencing argument.  Atty Morgan gives sentencing argument.  Def. makes statement. Atty Morgan rebuttals.  Def. replys. 6 months credit. 182 days credit if revoked.  Court questions why imposed sentence.  State gives reason.  
Court orders on ct 2 Imposed and stayed 4 1/2 years prison, 2 1/2 years initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision, Def. is eligible for Challenge & Substance Abuse Program stay 3 years probation,Completion with  AODA and follow through deemed by agent, costs, $250 DNA surcharge and sample. 182 days jail, deemed completed.  Def. advised of firearm and voting rights.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights. Def. given Written Explanation.  Atty Morgan heard on bond. Def. makes statement.  Bond to be returned to poster. Atty Morgan heard on transfer probation, and Def. wishes to moves to another State.  Def. must report to Langlade County Probation and Parole.  Judge orders def. can serve probation in Marathon Co. Moving will be up to Agent. State has no objetion to another state.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 30, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
Status conference on August 29, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on May 23, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant David J. Pray in court via video with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Defendant David J. Pray in custody.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF128 and 15CM140 @ 11:12 a.m. Atty Morgan gives arguments for bond reduction. Statement by Defendant. Arguments by State. Response by Defendant. Questions by the Court. Court will lower cash bond, covers both files.

Defendant David J. Pray in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Defendant David J. Pray in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  11:45 a.m./Case called.  15-CM-140 also called.  Waiver of preliminary hearing filed with Court.  Def. understands what a preliminary hearing is.  Def. waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court binds Def. over.  Information filed and Def. given a copy.  Def. waives reading and pleads not guilty to all counts.  Court receives pleas.  15-CM-140 also set for 9-14-15/3:30 p.m.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant David J. Pray in court, in custody & via-video with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls  @ 1:52 pm.  Atty Morgan has copy of complaint, Def has copy of complaint.  Def. is on a probation hold.  State gives bond recommendation. Atty Morgan waives reading of complaint & advised of charges & penalties. Atty Morgan does not object to signature bond.  Court orders $1,000.00 cash bond to cover both cases. (15CM140) Atty Morgan would like to waive p.h.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 11:30 am.
